meanings.sent1: She was procuring fresh vegetables from the market for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The detective was procuring evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: He was procuring his favorite toy from the top shelf.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was procuring acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was procuring water from the stream to quench his thirst.

meanings.definition: Persuade or cause (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was procuring the students to participate in the science fair.
meanings.sent2: She procured her friend to join her for the movie.
meanings.sent3: He procured his brother to share his toys.
meanings.sent4: The coach procured the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent5: The magician procured the audience to believe in magic.
